title: High Ping?
body:
I am also having high ping I thought I had fixed it with by changing out my Ethernet cable but that didn't work : /! Getting really tilted at this point it seems to have happened out of know where I am thinking it could be my modem but I am not sure I have tried everything in the book.But I used to get around 40-45 MS consistently and it never went above that.Now it goes all over the place I ran a speed test and I get 343mbps download/20mbps upload. I tried no firewall,ip release/renew and even  flushing my DNS AND I STILL cannot fix the issue >.> 

I am gonna exchange my ISP modem to see if that is the cause but is there anything I am missing to cause this sudden jump and to keep in mind I am running off of a wired connection.

replies.body:
Changes in latency can be caused by a number of different factors, the most common being changes in an ISP's network which can change routing to the server. 

Since you've already done a number of steps already, I recommend you run a set of traceroutes using [our guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2) You can also run a more in-depth set of traceroutes using [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/) with the IP address 192.64.170.1 for 5 minutes before exporting your results as a text.

Once you've gathered the traceroute, run a set of [Hextech Repair Logs](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs) and grab the URL from a completed [Network analysis](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1) and attach them with your [ticket submission.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) One of our tech specialists will be able to work with this info to get this resolved quickly.
